SEARCH
Package view.cli

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
view.cli.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
Utility class for the CLI IO To use do: `Utils utils = new Utils();` and once you have the network manager: `utils.setNetworkManager(networkManager);` this is needed, because we want to return the control to the CLI if an event arrived. Not that you can't use non-blocking options before the network manager has been set.
Author:
Marco

    • enumToOption

      private <E extends Enum<E> & OptionsInterface> String enumToOption(E e)
      Convert an enum to a string The enum name has to be underscore separated words. The first letter will be capitalized and the following will be lowered. Underscores will be converted in spaces. Example: `MY_ENUM` will be converted to `My enum`
      Parameters:
      e - the enum to convert

    • askOption

      public <E extends Enum<E> & OptionsInterface> E askOption(Class<E> enumClass)
      Read an option (blocking) The enum names will be converted by the `enumToOption` method and used as a prompt.
      Parameters:
      enumClass - the class of the enum that implements `OptionsInterface` from which to choose the option
      Returns:
      the read option

    • askOption

      public <E extends Enum<E> & OptionsInterface> E askOption(Class<E> enumClass, boolean isHost, boolean isTurn)
      Read an option (blocking) The enum names will be converted by the `enumToOption` method and used as a prompt. The parameters will be used to choose which options are available.
      Parameters:
      enumClass - the class of the enum that implements `OptionsInterface` from which to choose the option
      isHost - if the player is the host
      isTurn - if it's the player's turn
      Returns:
      the read option

    • askOptionOrEvent

      public <E extends Enum<E> & OptionsInterface> Optional<E> askOptionOrEvent(Class<E> enumClass, boolean doPrint, boolean isHost, boolean isTurn)
      Read an option or wait for an event The enum names will be converted by the `enumToOption` method and used as a prompt. The parameters will be used to choose which options are available. Since this function is designed to be called multiple times in the same way if an event arrives, there is an option not to print anything. It is up to the developer using this method, to ensure that the last printed options are the one from which the user can choose from.
      Parameters:
      enumClass - the class of the enum that implements `OptionsInterface` from which to choose the option
      doPrint - if the options should be printed
      isHost - if the player is the host
      isTurn - if it's the player's turn
      Returns:
      the read option
